sentences.en: "Don't you think you're being rather melodramatic?" Jane asked.
sentences.cn: 简问：“你难道不觉得自己有些太夸张了吗？”

sentences.en: Life is melodramatic, if you look at the whole sweep of it.
sentences.cn: 生命本身就很夸张, 如果你整体的去看.

sentences.en: Melville has abruptly and entirely altered his story; his prose became lushly melodramatic.
sentences.cn: 在这里梅尔维尔突然把故事改变了, 把文章写成热闹的通俗闹剧了.

sentences.en: She wanted to laugh at the melodramatic way he was acting.
sentences.cn: 他戏剧化的夸张架势使她忍不住想笑。

sentences.en: She'd flung herself in a pose of melodramatic exhaustion.
sentences.cn: 她一下子摆出一副筋疲力尽的夸张姿势。

sentences.en: The fellow could never resist the temptation to be melodramatic, Walden thought.
sentences.cn: 这家伙总想一鸣惊人, 沃尔登想.

sentences.en: This melodramatic shift in the seasons has forced the wild world to our attention.
sentences.cn: 这种戏剧性的季节变化迫使我们关注大自然.

sentences.en: We do a better service to ourselves and others by remaining detached and avoiding melodramatic reactions.
sentences.cn: 保持超然立场以及避免戏剧性的感伤反应对我们自己和别人都会有更好的助益.

words.tran_cn: 情节剧；音乐剧；耸人听闻的事件，闹剧
夸张的；情节剧的；戏剧似的

trans.tran_cn: 戏剧性的，感情夸张的，伤感的，耸人听闻的
